_description: A paraphrase of ‘Aspice mitissime conditor’, etc. — fourteen lines in 3- or 4-line stanzas

CamTCC323.First Lines:
Þu þad madist alle þincmi suete fadir hewene
                    kinc…
CamTCC323.Last Lines:
…fadir þau monkine abidon folieMid mine wondis for hem
                    mercy ic þe crie
CamTCC323.Note:
6-line Latin verse, ‘Aspice mitissime
                    conditor…’, precedes it; written two lines of verse per line in
                    MS.
CamTCC323.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             English Lyrics of the XIIIth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1932: 61.
